The National Association of Educational Broadcasters

Harold A. Engel, WHA
University of Wisconsin
Madison, Wisconsin

Gilbert D. Williams, WBAA
Purdue University
West Lafayette, Indiana

W. I. Griffith, WOI
Iowa State College
Ames, Iowa

H. H. Leake, WNAD

M. S. Novik, WNYC
E. J. O’Brien, KFJM
EXECUTIVE SECRETARY
Frank E. Schooley, WILL
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Ursana, IIIimoss
September 8, 1945
Dear NAEBer:
This is a personal note to you although ! must use a
MODERN TECHNIQUE OF GETTING LETTERS OUT TO ALL OUR MEMBERS
ON THE SAME DAY,
A NOTE FROM BOB COLEMAN OF 7'?KAR? |N THIS MORNING^S
MAIL, REMINDS ME THAT I HAVEN*T HEARD FROM ALL OF VOU ABOUT
OUR ANNUAL CONVENTION WHICH WILL BE HELD MONDAY AND TUESDAY,
SEPTEMBER 17 AND 18, AT THE LaSaLLE HOTEL IN CHICAGO,
One or two of you have advised me of your inability to
be present. Sorry, but perhaps you can reconsider.
Your president will be in
day, and Tuesday3 In fact, if
AFTERNOON, I EXPECT TO SEE IT,
WITH YOU IF YOU ARRIVE EARLY OR
Chicago all day Sunday, mon-
THER-E IS A BALL GAME SUNDAY
HlL BE HAPPY TO GET TOGETHER
LAT £ o
PLEASE LET ME OR JlM EBEL KNOW ABOUT YOUR INTENTIONS TO
ATTEND THE LUNCHEONS ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY, WE MUST MAKE
RESERVATIONS WITH THE HOTEL BEFORE CONVENTION STARTS, If
YOU SAY YOU#LL BE AT THE CONVENTION. ARE COUNTING ON YOU
FOR THE LUNCHEONS» We ARE NOT TYING YOU UP FOR THE EVENING
MEAL,
See you in Chicago,
Humbly yours,
Frank £, Schooley
PRESIDENT
